title: Leader in Renewable Energy Consumption
description: In 2021, DR Congo had a remarkable 96.3% of its total final energy consumption derived from renewable sources, showcasing its commitment to sustainable energy.

title: High Dependence on Combustible Renewables and Waste
description: By 2022, 92.9% of DR Congo's total energy consumption came from combustible renewables and waste, indicating a heavy reliance on traditional biomass.

title: Rapid Growth in Imports
description: In 2023, DR Congo experienced an 85.6% annual growth in imports of goods and services, reflecting a significant increase in international trade activities.

title: Significant Mineral Depletion
description: Mineral depletion accounted for 22.7% of DR Congo's GNI in 2021, highlighting the extensive extraction of natural resources.

title: High Mineral Rents Contribution to GDP
description: In 2021, mineral rents constituted 28.8% of DR Congo's GDP, underscoring the economy's reliance on mineral extraction.

title: High Rate of Out-of-School Primary Children
description: As of 2019, 63.2% of primary school-age children in DR Congo were out of school, indicating significant educational challenges.

title: Severe Poverty Levels
description: In 2020, 98% of DR Congo's population lived below the $8.30 a day poverty line, reflecting extreme poverty conditions.

title: High Multidimensional Poverty
description: 88% of the population in DR Congo was considered multidimensionally poor in 2020, highlighting widespread deprivation across multiple sectors.

title: Complete Binding Coverage of Products
description: In 2020, DR Congo achieved 100% binding coverage for all products, ensuring comprehensive trade commitments.

title: Dominance of Ores and Metals in Exports
description: By 2023, ores and metals made up 76.3% of DR Congo's merchandise exports, emphasizing the country's export dependency on these resources.

title: Lowest Urban Land Area Below 5 Meters
description: In 2015, only 0.00012% of DR Congo's urban land area was below 5 meters in elevation, indicating minimal risk from rising sea levels.

title: Minimal Travel Service Exports
description: As of 2023, travel services accounted for just 2.43% of DR Congo's service exports, reflecting a limited tourism sector.

title: Negligible Natural Gas Electricity Production
description: In 2018, only 0.92% of DR Congo's electricity was produced from natural gas sources, highlighting a reliance on other energy sources.

title: Low Fossil Fuel Energy Consumption
description: In 2022, fossil fuels made up just 3.97% of DR Congo's total energy consumption, indicating a lower carbon footprint compared to global averages.

title: Minimal CO2 Emissions from Buildings
description: DR Congo's building sector emitted only 0.0002 Mt CO2e in 2023, showcasing its low contribution to global carbon emissions.

title: Low Urban Population Below 5 Meters
description: In 2015, just 0.0036% of DR Congo's urban population lived in areas below 5 meters, minimizing flood risk.

title: Minimal Population Below 5 Meters
description: As of 2015, only 0.0128% of DR Congo's total population resided in areas below 5 meters elevation, reducing vulnerability to sea level rise.

title: Low Broad Money as GDP Percentage
description: In 2018, broad money constituted just 12.41% of DR Congo's GDP, indicating limited financial liquidity in the economy.

title: Negligible Natural Gas Rents
description: Natural gas rents contributed a mere 0.00006% to DR Congo's GDP in 2019, reflecting minimal economic reliance on natural gas.

title: Low Doctoral Educational Attainment
description: In 2016, only 0.03% of DR Congo's male population aged 25+ had attained a doctoral degree, highlighting educational challenges.

title: Limited Basic Drinking Water Access in Rural Areas
description: By 2022, only 13.8% of DR Congo's rural population had access to basic drinking water services, indicating significant infrastructure needs.

title: Low Overall Basic Drinking Water Access
description: As of 2022, just 35.12% of DR Congo's population had access to basic drinking water services, underscoring public health challenges.

title: Minimal Safely Managed Drinking Water in Rural Areas
description: In 2022, only 0.51% of DR Congo's rural population had access to safely managed drinking water services, highlighting critical needs.

title: Few Researchers in R&D
description: In 2015, DR Congo had only 10 researchers per million people, indicating limited investment in research and development.

title: Minimal Travel Service in Commercial Exports
description: Travel services made up just 3.26% of DR Congo's commercial service exports in 2023, reflecting a small tourism industry.
